startScreen.title: Shall We Get Married?
description: 5 intimate themes, 24 heartfelt question cards, guiding you to explore each other's values, wishes, and visions for the future.
There are no standard answers here, only moments of resonance unique to you. Are you ready to embark on a journey toward deeper understanding and intimacy?

endScreen.title: You've reached the end
endScreen.subtitle: But love is just beginning from here

questions.question: If one day you find out your child is gay, what would your attitude be?

more.A: Respect and bless them, I just hope they are happy
more.B: Not sure what to do, need some time to process
more.C: Hard to accept

questions.question: If you have children, what do you think is the ideal educational path?

more.A: Happy education: Respect the child's nature and curiosity. They don't need to be the best, but should be the happiest.
more.B: Achievement-oriented: Education shouldn't just go with the flow. It's okay to sacrifice some short-term childhood happiness for long-term development. That's true responsibility.
more.C: Haven't thought about it

questions.question: Do you agree that people should do age-appropriate things at each stage of life?

more.A: Agree, life has different tasks and goals at each stage
more.B: Disagree, there isn't just one script for life
more.C: No particular opinion

questions.question: Which of the following statements best matches your view on life paths and destiny?

more.A: Life trajectory is mostly determined by environment and social structure; what we can control is limited
more.B: The world is full of possibilities; everyone can create their own future through determination and effort
more.C: Instead of worrying about changing fate, it's better to focus on experiencing the present

questions.question: In five years, do you think you can live a better life through your own efforts?

more.A: I believe I definitely can
more.B: Hard to say, depends on luck and opportunities
more.C: If I still have a job in five years, that's good enough

questions.question: If you discuss future family retirement plans with your partner, how much money do you think counts as financial freedom?

more.A: Never stop striving: I hope to keep creating value; financial freedom isn't the ultimate goal
more.B: Safety first: Need enough assets and passive income to handle inflation, medical risks, etc. Security is important
more.C: Minimalism: Enough for the family's basic living, medical, and education needs. The less desire, the more freedom
more.D: Live in the moment: Spend what you earn, financial freedom isn't realistic

questions.question: If you are suddenly laid off, what would you do?

more.A: Take a short break and immediately start looking for the next job
more.B: Prepare to look for a stable government job or similar, aiming for security
more.C: Travel the world and pursue freedom, like becoming a digital nomad or blogger
more.D: It's a chance from fate! Time to switch to what I've always wanted to do
more.E: Don't want to work hard anymore

questions.question: Which of the following job offers is more attractive to you?

more.A: A stable position at a large company, with mid-to-high income but limited growth
more.B: A startup project, low income in the short term but you believe in its future potential
more.C: A jack-of-all-trades role at a small company, stressful but you can learn a lot

questions.question: One day, your partner suggests moving to another country together. What is your first reaction?

more.A: Excited, I've always wanted to experience a different world
more.B: Resistant, I don't want to easily give up my current life and job

questions.question: Your partner buys an expensive luxury item with their own money that you think is impractical. You would:

more.A: Support them, happiness is priceless
more.B: Don't really understand but respect their choice
more.C: Express your opinion reasonably and advise them not to fall into consumerism

questions.question: Which attitude toward saving money is closest to yours?

more.A: Very important, life is unpredictable
more.B: Save moderately, but not so much that it affects quality of life
more.C: Money is for life experiences; saving for the sake of saving is meaningless

questions.question: If you and your partner have a shared bank account, you would prefer:

more.A: Each contributes half
more.B: Whoever earns more contributes more
more.C: Whoever contributes less to household work (like chores or childcare) should contribute more financially
more.D: No need for a shared account, earn and spend separately

questions.question: What is your attitude toward prenuptial agreements?

more.A: Necessary, just in case. Talking about money doesn't hurt feelings
more.B: Hurts feelings, thinking about divorce before marriage
more.C: Never thought about it

questions.question: After marriage, how close do you want to live to both sets of parents?

more.A: Live nearby for convenience and care
more.B: Live far away to maintain independent space
more.C: Each lives their own life, hope to keep relative independence

questions.question: If you and your partner are from different hometowns, what is your ideal Chinese New Year arrangement after marriage?

more.A: Follow my partner's plan, my family is flexible
more.B: Try to go to my home, my family values these traditions
more.C: Take turns, this year at your home, next year at mine
more.D: Each goes to their own home
more.E: No need to go home, both families can travel together

questions.question: If your parents keep urging you to break up, what would you do?

more.A: Don't tell my partner, but since my parents keep saying it, I'll consider if they have a point
more.B: Tell my partner, discuss the issues, and try to solve them together
more.C: Ignore outside voices, even parents may not understand the real situation

questions.question: After getting together, what is your ideal way to divide household chores?

more.A: As evenly as possible (e.g., do together or take turns) to reduce inequality
more.B: Divide by expertise or preference (e.g., one cooks, the other washes dishes)
more.C: Whoever contributes more financially can do less housework
more.D: Hire help, try not to do it ourselves

questions.question: You accidentally find out your partner secretly watches borderline/risqu√© videos. What would you do?

more.A: Strongly condemn and ask them to unfollow
more.B: Unhappy, but won't ask them to unfollow
more.C: Doesn't matter, just pretend I didn't see
more.D: Tell them there's no need to be sneaky, they can watch openly

questions.question: What do you think about the sense of ritual on anniversaries?

more.A: Essential, without it the relationship will wither
more.B: I don't care, but if my partner needs it, I'll cooperate
more.C: Don't like it, what's important is the little things in daily life

questions.question: Do you think physical attraction is important in a long-term intimate relationship?

more.A: Very important, sexual attraction is the cornerstone of a high-quality relationship
more.B: Important, but not the only standard. Emotional and spiritual connection matter more
more.C: Not very important, intimacy can go beyond physical attraction

questions.question: If you are in a stable relationship but develop a clear and strong crush on someone else, what would you do?

more.A: Loyalty first: Since I've committed to my partner, I should cut off feelings and avoid temptation
more.B: Rebuild relationship: Liking someone else means there's no love left for my current partner, so I should responsibly choose the new person
more.C: Be honest: Tell my partner about my feelings, share my emotional state, the most important thing is not to hide
more.D: Rational evaluation: Analyze why I have a crush, whether it reflects something missing in the relationship, and weigh whether to continue

questions.question: You've never been apart for long since being together, but now your partner tells you they need to go on a business trip for a month. What is your natural reaction?

more.A: Pretty sad, living alone is lonely
more.B: Doesn't matter, as long as we keep in touch
more.C: Great, finally some alone time

questions.question: When making personal decisions in a relationship, you tend to:

more.A: Hope to get my partner's support and approval as much as possible
more.B: Respect their opinion, but ultimately decide for myself
more.C: Basically don't need their opinion

questions.question: If your partner gets a job opportunity in another city and decides to go, what would you do?

more.A: Start looking for a job there and try to go together
more.B: Can do long-distance for now, see what happens later
more.C: As long as I earn significantly more, try to persuade them to stay
more.D: Can't do long-distance at all, need to reconsider the relationship
